translation.text: Maaroo, Solahas, Fifth Mehl:

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

author.author: None

translation.text: He infused His power into the earth.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: He suspends the heavens upon the feet of His Command.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਅਗਨਿ ਉਪਾਇ ਈਧਨ ਮਹਿ ਬਾਧੀ ਸੋ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਰਾਖੈ ਭਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੧॥

translation.text: He created fire and locked it into wood. That God protects all, O Siblings of Destiny. ||1||

transliteration.text: agan upāi īdhan mah bādhī sō prabh rākhai bhāī hē .1.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: He gives nourishment to all beings and creatures.

translation.text: He Himself is the all-powerful Creator, the Cause of causes.

text: ਖਿਨ ਮਹਿ ਥਾਪਿ ਉਥਾਪਨਹਾਰਾ ਸੋਈ ਤੇਰਾ ਸਹਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੨॥

translation.text: In an instant, He establishes and disestablishes; He is your help and support. ||2||

transliteration.text: khin mah thāp uthāpanahārā sōī tērā sahāī hē .2.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. translation.text: With every breath and morsel of food, He is with you, and takes care of you.

text: ਸਦਾ ਸਦਾ ਜਪੀਐ ਸੋ ਪ੍ਰੀਤਮੁ ਵਡੀ ਜਿਸੁ ਵਡਿਆਈ ਹੇ ॥੩॥

translation.text: Forever and ever, meditate on that Beloved; Great is His glorious greatness! ||3||

transliteration.text: sadā sadā japīai sō prītam vadī jis vadiāī hē .3.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: The sultans and nobles are reduced to dust in an instant.

text: ਗਰਬ ਨਿਵਾਰਣ ਸਰਬ ਸਧਾਰਣ ਕਿਛੁ ਕੀਮਤਿ ਕਹੀ ਨ ਜਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੪॥

translation.text: He is the Destroyer of egotistical pride, the Support of all. His value cannot be estimated. ||4||

transliteration.text: garab nivāran sarab sadhāran kish kīmat kahī n jāī hē .4.

text: ਮਾਤ ਪਿਤਾ ਸੁਤ ਬੰਧਪ ਭਾਈ ਜਿਨਿ ਇਹ ਸ੍ਰਿਸਟਿ ਉਪਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੫॥

translation.text: He alone is my mother, father, child, relative and sibling, who created this Universe. ||5||

transliteration.text: māt pitā sut bandhap bhāī jin ih srisat upāī hē .5.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਪ੍ਰਭ ਆਏ ਸਰਣਾ ਭਉ ਨਹੀ ਕਰਣਾ ॥

translation.text: I have come to God's Sanctuary, and so I fear nothing.

transliteration.text: prabh āē saranā bhau nahī karanā .

translation.text: In the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, I am sure to be saved.

text: ਮਨ ਬਚ ਕਰਮ ਅਰਾਧੇ ਕਰਤਾ ਤਿਸੁ ਨਾਹੀ ਕਦੇ ਸਜਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੬॥

translation.text: One who adores the Creator in thought, word and deed, shall never be punished. ||6||

transliteration.text: man bach karam arādhē karatā tis nāhī kadē sajāī hē .6.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਗੁਣ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਮਨ ਤਨ ਮਹਿ ਰਵਿਆ ॥

translation.text: One whose mind and body are permeated with the Lord, the treasure of virtue,

transliteration.text: gun nidhān man tan mah raviā .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. text: ਜਨਮ ਮਰਣ ਕੀ ਜੋਨਿ ਨ ਭਵਿਆ ॥

translation.text: does not wander in birth, death and reincarnation.

transliteration.text: janam maran kī jōn n bhaviā .

text: ਦੂਖ ਬਿਨਾਸ ਕੀਆ ਸੁਖਿ ਡੇਰਾ ਜਾ ਤ੍ਰਿਪਤਿ ਰਹੇ ਆਘਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੭॥

translation.text: Pain vanishes and peace prevails, when one is satisfied and fulfilled. ||7||

transliteration.text: dūkh binās kīā sukh dērā jā tripat rahē āghāī hē .7.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਸਿਮਰਿ ਸਿਮਰਿ ਪੂਰਨ ਪਰਮੇਸੁਰ ਚਿੰਤਾ ਗਣਤ ਮਿਟਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੮॥

translation.text: Meditating, meditating in remembrance on the Perfect Transcendent Lord, I am rid of all anxieties and calculations. ||8||

transliteration.text: simar simar pūran paramēsur chintā ganat mitāī hē .8.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਹਰਿ ਕਾ ਨਾਮੁ ਕੋਟਿ ਲਖ ਬਾਹਾ ॥

translation.text: One who has the Name of the Lord has hundreds of thousands and millions of arms.

transliteration.text: har kā nām kōt lakh bāhā .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. text: ਹਰਿ ਜਸੁ ਕੀਰਤਨੁ ਸੰਗਿ ਧਨੁ ਤਾਹਾ ॥

translation.text: The wealth of the Kirtan of the Lord's Praises is with him.

transliteration.text: har jas kīratan sang dhan tāhā .

text: ਗਿਆਨ ਖੜਗੁ ਕਰਿ ਕਿਰਪਾ ਦੀਨਾ ਦੂਤ ਮਾਰੇ ਕਰਿ ਧਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੯॥

translation.text: In His Mercy, God has blessed me with the sword of spiritual wisdom; I have attacked and killed the demons. ||9||

transliteration.text: giān kharag kar kirapā dīnā dūt mārē kar dhāī hē .9.

text: ਹਰਿ ਕਾ ਜਾਪੁ ਜਪਹੁ ਜਪੁ ਜਪਨੇ ॥

translation.text: Chant the Chant of the Lord, the Chant of Chants.

transliteration.text: har kā jāp japah jap japanē .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: Be a winner of the game of life and come to abide in your true home.

text: ਲਖ ਚਉਰਾਸੀਹ ਨਰਕ ਨ ਦੇਖਹੁ ਰਸਕਿ ਰਸਕਿ ਗੁਣ ਗਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੧੦॥

translation.text: You shall not see the 8.4 million types of hell; sing His Glorious Praises and remain saturated with loving devotion||10||

transliteration.text: lakh chaurāsīh narak n dēkhah rasak rasak gun gāī hē .10.

translation.text: He is lofty, unfathomable, inaccessible and infinite.

text: ਜਿਸ ਨੋ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾ ਕਰੇ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਅਪਨੀ ਸੋ ਜਨੁ ਤਿਸਹਿ ਧਿਆਈ ਹੇ ॥੧੧॥

translation.text: That humble being, unto whom God grants His Grace, meditates on Him. ||11||

transliteration.text: jis nō kripā karē prabh apanī sō jan tisah dhiāī hē .11.

translation.text: God has broken my bonds, and claimed me as His own.

translation.text: In His Mercy, He has made me the slave of His home.

text: ਅਨਹਦ ਰੁਣ ਝੁਣਕਾਰੁ ਸਹਜ ਧੁਨਿ ਸਾਚੀ ਕਾਰ ਕਮਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੧੨॥

translation.text: The unstruck celestial sound current resounds and vibrates, when one performs acts of true service. ||12||

transliteration.text: anahad run jhunakār sahaj dhun sāchī kār kamāī hē .12.

translation.text: O God, I have enshrined faith in You within my mind.

translation.text: My egotistical intellect has been driven out.

text: ਅੰਗੀਕਾਰੁ ਕੀਆ ਪ੍ਰਭਿ ਅਪਨੈ ਜਗ ਮਹਿ ਸੋਭ ਸੁਹਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੧੩॥

translation.text: God has made me His own, and now I have a glorious reputation in this world. ||13||

transliteration.text: angīkār kīā prabh apanai jag mah sōbh suhāī hē .13.

text: ਬਲਿ ਬਲਿ ਜਾਈ ਪ੍ਰਭ ਅਪੁਨੇ ਈਸੈ ॥

translation.text: I am a sacrifice, a sacrifice to my Lord God.

transliteration.text: bal bal jāī prabh apunē īsai .

text: ਤਿਸੁ ਬਿਨੁ ਦੂਜਾ ਅਵਰੁ ਨ ਦੀਸੈ ਏਕਾ ਜਗਤਿ ਸਬਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੧੪॥

translation.text: I do not see any other except Him. The One Lord pervades the whole world. ||14||

transliteration.text: tis bin dūjā avar n dīsai ēkā jagat sabāī hē .14.

text: ਸਿਮਰਿ ਸਿਮਰਿ ਜੀਵਹਿ ਜਨ ਤੇਰੇ ਏਕੰਕਾਰਿ ਸਮਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੧੫॥

translation.text: Your humble servants live by meditating, meditating in remembrance on You, merging in You, O One Universal Creator. ||15||

transliteration.text: simar simar jīvah jan tērē ēkankār samāī hē .15.

text: ਸਿਮਰਿ ਨਾਮੁ ਪੁੰਨੀ ਸਭ ਇਛਾ ਜਨ ਨਾਨਕ ਪੈਜ ਰਖਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੧੬॥੧॥

translation.text: Meditating in remembrance on the Naam, the Name of the Lord, all desires are fulfilled. He has saved the honor of servant Nanak. ||16||1||

transliteration.text: simar nām punnī sabh ishā jan nānak paij rakhāī hē .16.1.
